transcript.text: A1 argues that most CMV posters use the subreddit as a personal soapbox, reinforcing their own views with familiar narratives and rarely engaging in substantive debate or self‑reflection. A2 counters that, citing empirical data, the majority actually engage with evidence, ask clarifying questions, and revise positions when presented with new information, thanks to the subreddit’s citation requirements, encouragement of counter‑arguments, and moderation that rewards open‑mindedness. claims.text: The majority of CMV posters actively engage with evidence and revise positions.
Subreddit design and moderation incentivize open‑minded discussion rather than soapboxing.

evidence.text: Analysis of 10,000 CMV comments shows that 68% contain at least one citation, and 42% of users who initially posted a claim later added new evidence or retracted the claim within 48 hours.

warrants.text: When users are required to provide citations, they must consult external sources, which increases the likelihood of encountering contradictory evidence and thus revising their stance.

rebuttals.target_claim_summary: Opponent claims that a minority use the subreddit as a soapbox.

evidence.text: A 2023 audit of 10,000 CMV posts found only 27% included a citation and 68% contained at least one self‑referential phrase such as "I believe" or "my experience".
